paper_abstract: A graph G = (V, E) is arbitrarily partitionable (AP) if for any sequence tau = (n(1), ... , n(p)) of positive integers adding up to the order of G, there is a sequence of mutually disjoint subsets of V whose sizes are given by tau and which induce connected graphs. If, additionally, for given k, it is possible to prescribe l = min{k, p} vertices belonging to the first l subsets of tau, G is said to be AP + k. The paper contains the proofs that the kth power of every traceable graph of order at least k is AP + (k - 1) and that the kth power of every hamiltonian graph of order at least 2k is AP + (2k - 1), and these results are tight. (C) 2013 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Partitioning powers of traceable or hamiltonian graphs
